intro: Arctotis lancea, commonly known as the narrowleaf arctotis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces vibrant blue to purple flowers. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes. Arctotis lancea prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it a hardy plant in suitable climates.
